name: Contradiction Canyon
description:
This canyon is described in limited detail in Canyons Near Sydney by Rick Jamieson. Help the Australian canyoning community by contributing track notes to ropewiki.com

  • OzUltimate.com : Tom Brennan, photos
  • OzUltimate.com : Tom Brennan, report
  • Fat Canyoners : Galah & Contradiction Canyons almost in a day
  • YouTube.com : Richard Pattison, Contradiction Canyon movie


Background

David Noble said of the first descent: 26 Nov 77, visited by a Springwood B.C. & SUBW party (Bob Sault, Dave Noble, Ross Bradstock, Tom Williams). Named because the members of the party kept on contradicting themselves in a Monty Pythonish manner on the way to the creek (no they didn't!)

The canyon played a significant role in David Noble's thoughts on the release, or more to the point, the non-release, of canyon beta. On OzCanyons, David Noble wrote: "I described the canyon in some of my Wild magazine notes in the early 80's - but was dismayed to later hear of a bolt in the canyon and a track being formed to it - so left it out of future canyon guides."
